p: For in vitro adenovirus neutralization experiments, 100 μl of A549 cells (3 × 10 5 cells/ml) were seeded in each well of 96-well plates incubated overnight at 37°C in a 5% CO 2 atmosphere. Purified 10G12 was serially diluted 2-fold from 25 to 0.1 μg/ml in DMEM, and 50 μl aliquots of each dilution were mixed with 50 μl HAdV-7 or HAdV-55 with 100TCID 50. Anti-DENV1 (Lu et al., 2018) and anti-EGFR (CN102993305B) antibodies served as negative controls. Antibody-virus mixtures were incubated at 37°C for 1 h, transferred to 96-well plates containing 85–95% confluent A549 cell monolayers, and cultured in DMEM without Phenol Red or serum for 72 h. Infected cells were observed under a microscope and the number of holes in cells with lesions was counted.
